content.title: Arterial Duplex Ultrasound Protocol
content.definition: A comprehensive ultrasound examination of the lower extremity arterial system using B-mode imaging and pulsed-wave Doppler to evaluate for peripheral artery disease and graft surveillance.

clinical_features.imaging: Gray-scale assessment of arterial walls, plaque
clinical_features.doppler: Spectral waveform analysis at each segment
clinical_features.color: Color flow to identify focal acceleration, occlusion
clinical_features.segments: Aorta, iliacs, CFA, SFA, popliteal, tibials

concepts.definition: Doppler criteria for grading stenosis severity.

clinical_features.normal: Triphasic waveform, PSV <150 cm/s in native vessels

concepts.definition: Protocol for monitoring vein bypass grafts.

clinical_features.psv: Absolute PSV <45 cm/s suggests impending failure

clinical_features.biphasic: Early disease, loss of flow reversal

clinical_features.accuracy: 85-90% agreement with angiography for significant stenosis

sources.reference: Gerhard-Herman MD et al. J Vasc Surg. 2018;68:1851-1867
Collins R et al. Vasc Med. 2015;20:536-544
